author: sussman
msg: Doc tweaks.
* README:  tell people to read the Handbook, not a non-existent document.
* INSTALL:  don't tell people to chmod 777 the repository.  just make
sure httpd has read/write access to it.

author: fitz
msg: Refine the answer

author: fitz
msg: Now that Subversion is alpha, we no longer want to discourage people from using it so change the answer accordingly.

author: blair
msg: Makefile rules for documentation and svn:ignore cleanup.  Generate one
big HTML file from a .texi instead of many smaller ones.  If people
want a number of smaller HTML pages, then we can set up a new rule for
that, something like doc-html-tree.
* Makefile.in:
(.texi.dvi):
Some versions of texi2dvi do not know about the -I command line
option, so do not use it.
(.texi.html)
Some versions of makeinfo do not like to generate HTML output with
the --html command line option and also have --no-headers set,
which is just for text output, so do not use --no-headers.
Tell makeinfo to generate a single HTML file instead of multiple
HTML files contained in a new target directory.
* doc:
Remove the svn:ignore property completely.  I don't think there's
anything in this directory that gets built any more, so there's
nothing to ignore.
* doc/handbook:
To reflect that Makefile.in now creates svn-handbook.html instead of
a directory named svn-handbook, remove svn-handbook from the
svn:ignore property list.
* doc/programmer/design:
To reflect that Makefile.in now creates svn-design.html instead of a
directory named svn-design, remove svn-design from the svn:ignore
property list.
